data.title: Display status bars dropdown
data.body:
Adds an option to always display actor status bars only on actors
that have sustained damage.

Changed 'always show' checkbox functionality to a dropdown listing
'standard', 'show on damage' and 'always show' options.

Changed the togglable 'always show' status bars hotkey functionality
to cyclable.

http://imgur.com/r2K1wVF

http://imgur.com/jicKUac

First proper PR; StarCraft like damaged unit health bars. I know next to nothing about C# so advice and criticism is very much welcome - you will just have to be explicit in stating what exactly needs changing and what to.

data.title: Balance mcv crate
data.body:
Completely removes the chance of getting an MCV from a crate
in the TS and RA mod unless the player has no base remaining.

New PR to support both mods thanks to penevs feedback in IRC ;)
Also adjusted comment formatting.

Originally stemmed from a comment by @pchote in #9629

data.title: mcv from crates only when a player has no base
data.body:
completely removes the chance of getting an MCV from a crate 
in the RA mod unless the player has no base remaining

Stems from a comment from @pchote in #9629

data.title: Shock troopers powering tesla coils will "ignore" attack moves
data.body:
(on bleed)
When a shock trooper is "attached" to a tesla coil you can't move him away with an attack move.
He **doesn't really ignore** the command but he defaults back to "attacking" the coil (probably because it's the nearest thing) which is a bit annoying.

Edit:
- will however prefer attacking nearby enemy units but only **if he's not already "attached"** to the coil (probably a wanted behavior)
- won't return fire when he's "stuck" on coil (debatable behavior)

data.title: Temporary fix for missiles launched from zero height
data.body:
Fixes choosing minimum launch speed for missiles launched at or below terrain height.

Takes care of #9645.

data.title: Missile behaviour regression
data.body:
![screen shot 2015-10-16 at 08 13 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/10535835/117773e8-73de-11e5-979d-e6ae5d7a6aec.png)

Missiles from the TD SAM site will no longer hit aircraft outside more than ~75% of its nominal max range.  I'm not sure whether this is caused by an effective decrease in the missile speed (which will have even wider balance implications), a specific regression to the lifetime check, or some other factor.

I expect this will affect other missile types from the other mods too.

data.title: Update gdi-vehicles.yaml
data.body:
Changed because the thing was stronger than a Mammoth Mk 2

Previously set to 800.

Tiberian Sun value was set to 175

Changed to 175 to match Tiberian Sun. Verified other values matched Rules.ini

data.title: TS Mod - Wolverines are extremely durable
data.body: Noted that wolverines are nearly indestructible in the current build of the bleeding game (2015-10-15)

data.title: Encrypt teamchat (or otherwise don't send it to other team)
data.body:
Team chat should probably be encrypted with some simple symmetrical key scheme, or otherwise not sent to the all clients. Otherwise anyone can modify their client to see all opponent's teamchat, like [so](https://github.com/ChaoticMind/OpenRA/commit/1ad9784128108c70266b29f82d442d112a6218dc)

However, if I understand it correctly, all orders go through the dedicated server or game host, so if we choose to not send it all clients, the host would still be able to cheat. Besides, if we don't send them, they can't be shown in replays.

If we encrypt the chat instead, we will need to transfer the key between team members in some peer to peer fashion.

This has implications on whether replays would show all teamchat or not. If we want to show all teamchat in a replay, we'll need to transfer the keys to all opponents after the game has ended. This of course won't work if the game crashes or a player quits (although they could perhaps also be sent on surrender/abort).

data.title: Light factory production lights
data.body:
[This video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AEHRiRxCR9Q) shows the Light factory (at least the Atreides one, I haven't really investigated this) having production lights at the back. Seen between 2:16 and 2:20.
Our current factory has production lights only at the front.

data.title: Add the missing lua files to OpenRA.sln
Add team chat for spectators
data.body: Closes #2062.

data.title: Change mouse cursors while joystick scrolling
data.body:
This patch adds mouse cursors to the joystick scrolling feature.

On Tiberian Sun, which itself had joystick scrolling, the same cursors are
used as in the original game.

As the older games did not have joystick scrolling, I've had to make a
best-effort guess as to what were suitable cursors.
  -> When scrolling in all directions is available, the default arrow
     cursor is used.
  -> When a direction is blocked, the edge-scrolling blocked direction
     cursor is used.

data.title: Reduce InitialSpawnDelay for crates in TD
data.body: Fixes #9629.

data.title: Remove a redundant check
data.body: This avoids enumerating the `mcvs` twice in `FindAndDeployBackupMcv` for no reason.

data.title: Speed up checks for IOccupySpace trait
data.body:
Eagerly load the trait (if it exists) in Actor, and use this reference to avoid having to perform `self.Info.HasTraitInfo<IOccupySpaceInfo>()` checks.

The main benefit is for `IsAtGroundLevel`, which is used during pathfinding for crushability checks. Therefore this saves us a lookup for every actor we need to check for crushability on our path.

data.title: Fix bridge destruction and repair.
data.body:
The bridge hut spawning is sensitive to the order that the bridges were spawned on the map: it assumes that southern bridges were spawned before northern bridges, which only worked because we used to index the map in the bridge spawner in a non-standard way (column-major instead of row-major).  When 26ce7b5e1c3e6f8c7eaf359e14faaedf9954e470 fixed the map enumeration the code ended attaching bridges to the wrong ends of eachother, and this flowed on to the bridge huts being connected wrong.

This fix inverts the assumption above so that bridges are assumed to spawn north-to-south (which matches what we do), but the whole method is bogus and really should be rewritten at some point.

Fixes #9592.
Fixes #9192.

data.title: Added the movement classes of the domain index to the debug logs
data.body: I was just told that the domain indices are calculated per movement class and wanted to share that insight somehow.

data.title: Factor weapon name into SpreadDamageWarhead exceptions
data.body: The InvalidOperationExceptions would be far more useful if they actually told the modder which weapon carried that warhead.

data.title: Pick map by general category
data.body:
Something like this could make map selection much easier, especially if you have a lot of maps installed.

![selmapmockup](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2159248/10470545/4d3db4fe-720e-11e5-9c9b-44aae3f7353e.png)

data.title: Five minute initial crate spawn delay is probably too long
data.body: I forgot about this until watching https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nKePUk5DBuQ, where fiveaces and @SoScared comment that they think this is a bad change.  I agree, this seems far too long.  A TD game can be half way finished by five minutes.  A 30 - 60 second (max) delay to prevent spawn-time crates would be much more reasonable.

data.title: Fix Utils.FormatTime not working properly on different game speeds
Avoid redundant copies of mix files in memory
data.body:
The mix file on disk stores all the game assets. For each asset in the file, we copy the portion of the file we need into memory. This works nicely but is a bit wasteful.

With this PR, we don't make copies, instead we just return a "view" into the overall file so we don't have to copy everything. This allows us to leave the file sitting on disk without copying whole chunks of it into memory and never letting go.

Once we load into the shellmap, we make the following memory savings:
- RA saves ~16 MiB.
- RA2 saves ~ 253 MiB.

data.title: Licensing: specify GPL version in headers and README.md
data.body:
The licensing info in the README.md and in headers currently states: "It is made available to you under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation. For more information, see COPYING."

It does not specify which version of the GPL applies. When checking COPYING, one can see it is the GPL version 3, but there is no mention as to whether the "or any later version" clause applies. I would suggest to make it clearer at least in the README.md, and ideally also in the code header. If you go for GPLv3+ (3 or any later version), a typical license declaration would read:

```
# This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
# it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
# the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
# (at your option) any later version.
```

data.title: System.IO.EndOfStreamException at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile
data.body:
Tiberian Dawn Mod at Version release-20150919
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Attempted to read past the end of the stream.
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadBytes(Stream s, Byte[] buffer, Int32 offset, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadBytes(Stream s, Int32 count)
   at OpenRA.StreamExts.ReadUInt16(Stream s)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.MixFile..ctor(String filename, PackageHashType type, Int32 priority)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.OpenPackage(String filename, String annotation, Int32 order)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.<Mount>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.Mount(String name, String annotation)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.GlobalFileSystem.LoadFromManifest(Manifest manifest)
   at OpenRA.ModData.PrepareMap(String uid)
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type)
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap()
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

data.title: More RA-Balance changes for the next playtest
data.body:
Change Hijackers speed from 56 to 85 (same speed as a medium tank and harvester)

Change Hijackers "WarnProbability" from 75 to 95 so its less likely that he gets crushed

Add the "Cloak-Trait" to the Hijacker which makes him invisible when idle ... ever Infantry-Unit can detect him along with every other "Cloak-detecting" unit or structure

Change Chinooks shroud-revealing from 12 to 10 .. so he is equally good as the Hind when it comes to scouting
